result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Waylon James Hochstetler

records.addlTxt:
11:30 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: S. Bridges. Defendant Waylon James Hochstetler in court, in custody.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Set for PH. DDA Ellenwood notes letter from PD's office that no attorney has been appointed yet. Court finds good cause to extend time for the hearing. Adjourned 11:35 PM. srb
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
to change PH to STC on 11/2 due to attorney not assigned. Filed by SPD Tamora H. arc   to bk
Filed by DA Office Erin M. arc

- Defendant to test clean prior to release. 

- Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from the residence in the presence of law enforcement ONLY. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, P.J. or residence..  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least 1 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:43 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Schmidt in court. Defendant Waylon James Hochstetler in court, in custody. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. DE is on PO HOLD. Jackson Co. PO Agent Heidi H. DE confirms address. Court sets PH with TCH. Adjourned 01:51 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.
